Assignment.Measure: Band Playing Assessment 1, Creating Click Track and Recording Multi-Tracks
Assignment.MeasureDescription:
Record one of the following assessment options of your choice below with a click track. Submit an audio recording of your assessment to Teams Assignments in an mp3 format. Choose your own rhythm for scale performance but keep that rhythm consistent for all scales.
1.	Play 2 major scales from memory in key circle order: Concert F and Concert Bb. M.M. = 68 – 74 bpm. One octave ascending and descending. Articulate (tongue) each note.
2.	Play 6 major scales from memory in key circle order: Concert G, Concert C, Concert F, Concert Bb, Concert Eb, and Concert Ab. M.M. = 68 – 74 bpm. One octave ascending and descending. Articulate (tongue) each note.
3.	Play all major scales from memory in key circle order. M.M. = your choice, but we recommend that you choose a tempo that will allow you to play each scale accurately. One octave ascending only. Articulate (tongue) each note.
Submission Instructions
•	Create a click track in Audacity or alternative digital audio workstation (DAW). Set the click track to a tempo of your choice but within the prescribed tempo range if you have selected scales options 1 or 2.
•	Record your scales assessment in Audacity or alternative DAW as a second track.
•	Trim the click track so that it matches the length of your scales track.
•	Export your combined tracks (project) as an mp3 audio file.
•	Label your mp3 audio file with your full name and scales option that you recorded. Ex. "Mr. Gillespie, option 3"
•	Upload your mp3 audio file to the Teams Assignments under the "Playing Assessment 1, Major Scales with Click Track" assignment.

Assignment.MeasureDescription:
Record yourself performing your completed melody composition assignment. If you wrote your piece for an instrument that you do not play, then adapt it as best you can transposing and adjusting the range as needed. We will share recordings and score (what you wrote) in our lab groups next IB Music session.

Submission instructions:
-Submit an mp3 format of audio recording (not video) to this Teams assignment page.
-Also attach your mp3 file of your recording to your posted Melody Composition 1.1 assignment in your class OneNote located in your Creating file. This is for the purpose of collecting evidence and progress in your IB Music portfolio.
-Label the mp3 with your first and last name, class period, and title (if you have one) (Ex. "Mick Jagger, period 5, Start Me Up")

Assignment.Type: Orch. - Rehearsals, Sectionals, and Practice Logs

Assignment.MeasureDescription:
Due: Friday, October 2

Compose a melody of approximately eight measures length for any voice or instrument of your choice. Include in your notation:

•	Time Signature
•	Key Signature
•	Bar Lines
•	Dynamic Markings
•	Accents
•	Phrase Markings
•	Instrument or Voice

You may notate your melody composition by hand using the blank staff below or on separate staff paper, or you may use Musescore or any notation software.

Submission: complete, print, or export (as a PDF document) your composition to your Creating file in our class OneNote.
